Description: Use the chrome.alarms module to schedule code to run periodically or at a specified time in the future.
Availability: Google Chrome 22
Permissions: "alarms"
Learn more: Event Pages

Alarm frequency limits

In order to reduce the load on the user's machine, Chrome limits alarms to at most once every 5 minutes but may delay them an arbitrary amount more. That is, setting $ref:[alarms.AlarmCreateInfo.delayInMinutes delayInMinutes] or $ref:[alarms.AlarmCreateInfo.periodInMinutes periodInMinutes] to less than 5 will cause an error. $ref:[alarms.AlarmCreateInfo.when when] can be set to less than 5 minutes after "now" but won't actually cause the alarm to run for at least 5 minutes.

To help you debug your app or extension, when you've loaded it unpacked, there's no limit to how often the alarm can fire.
